intro: Monoon shendurunii, commonly known as the Sri Lanka moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the wet zone of Sri Lanka. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its nocturnal blooming habit, with large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night. The plant has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, red berries that contain the seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in dense forests or along stream banks. Due to its unique flowering pattern and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
